comments.body:
should have circular-reference and use-before-def tests, too. (eg `#foo = 1 + #foo` and `#foo = #bar; #bar = #foo`) 
There might some below. I'll delete this comment if so.

Added test privateNamesUseBeforeDef.ts The behavior is the same as for public fields (good).

Here's what I see in the language service when I put the code in a separate project:

![nice](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4691093/61370390-36366b00-a88a-11e9-9bef-8b84d0c8c516.PNG)

There's a nice message about the circularity.

However, I can't get the circularity message to show up in test baselines (even in a fourslash test). If I should add it, do you have any tips?
